question: Hello.
answer: How's the move going?

question: Horrible. The cable guy is missing in action. Apparently he's going to be here sometime between eight AM and my death.
answer: You haven't called Robin have you? Please tell me you didn't call her.

question: No, I'm giving her space. I can't believe she's doing this.
answer: You never should have asked her to marry you. You're the mad smotherer.

question: All she had to do was say no. She didn't have to kick me out. I feel like Felix Unger.
answer: You forced her to evaluate the relationship. If you didn't propose she would never have realized how unhappy she was.

question: I can't. I'm working double shifts the rest of the week.
answer: It's my first night here. Don't do this to me.

question: The other camera guy pulled out his back. Besides, I spent the last two weeks with you on my couch. Isn't that enough?
answer: Fine, fine.

question: One piece of advice. Slip the cable guy fifty bucks, he'll give you all the movie channels for free. Even the dirty ones.
answer: I couldn't. I'm not good at that stuff. What if he says no? I'll feel like an idiot.

question: None of them say no, believe me. I'll talk to you later.
answer: Where the hell is he?

question: Forget it. Idiots. Oh great. Don't leave! I'm here! I'm here!
answer: Hello! Cable Guy!

question: Hey, wait!
answer: Well, look who decided to show up. I was just gonna go collect my retirement pension.

question: You were supposed to be here four hours ago.
answer: Was I? So I'm the tardy one. Good to know.

question: Yes. I had to go to the Bed 'n Bath place, but now it's closed.
answer: Maybe I shouldn't have come at all  jerk off! I'm just joking. Let's do this. Oh, the old McNair place. I never thought they'd get the floors clean after what happened here.

question: What happened?
answer: They had a lot of cats. Hey, this could be a cool pad. Here is a comment card. Please mail it in when I am done.

question: These go to your boss?
answer: No, they go to me. I'm a perfectioniss perfectioniss perfectionisst. Now let's take a look at what we're dealing with. Come on baby. Come on baby. Talk to me baby. Tell me where you like it. That's it baby. Here's your sweet spot. So your lady kicked you out.

question: What?
answer: In preparing your service I noticed you were previously wired across town at 1268 and a half Chestnut. Last week the billing was transferred to one Robin Harris. Smells like heartbreak to me.

question: I really don't want to talk about it with you. Could you please just install my cable? I'm going to get dressed.
answer: No sweat. Hey, I'm going to go to the hallway so I can access the floorboards. Don't be spooked if you hear someone crawling underneath you.

question: Okay, whatever.
answer: Put on your bathing suit 'cause you'll be channel surfing in no time.

question: How's it going?
answer: Guilty, guilty, guilt-freakin-tee. I hope they fry this bastard.

question: What happened?
answer: The arrangement of your major appliances and your furniture was causing some noisy pics and hum bars in your reception. I moved a few things. Cleared it right up. Is that cool?

question: I guess so.
answer: You programmed? Then let me slave your remotes. Ooh, maybe we should leave these two alone.

question: So after this I'll only need one remote for everything?
answer: You know you're pretty good at this. You could be a cable guy yourself. Now let me check your levels. All right. That about does it. I just have some paperwork for you to fill out. Sign here. That gave me power of attorney over you. Joking. I'm about finished here. Okay. I feel good about this.

question: One thing.
answer: Yeah!

question: I uh I have this friend and he said he gave his cable guy fifty bucks and he got free movie channels. Have you ever heard of anything like that?
answer: You mean illegal cable?

question: Uh yes.
answer: Who told you that? I want his name.

question: Forget it.
answer: You're offering me a bribe? What you have just done is illegal, and in this state if convicted, you could be fined five-thousand dollars or spend six months in a correctional facility.

question: Please that was dumb. I was just making conversation
answer: I'm just jerking your chain. Wake up little snoozy. I'll juice you up. All it is is a push of a button.

question: Oh, great. How much?
answer: Don't worry about it. I couldn't charge you. Your girl just booted you. Consider it one guy doing another guy a solid.

question: That is so nice.
answer: Hey, you're a 'nice' guy. You'd be surprised how many customers treat you like shit, like I'm a god damn plumber or something. Here is my personal beeper number. It's just for my preferred customers. Never call the company, they'll just put you on hold.

question: Thanks. Really. You're gonna get some good marks here.
answer: Maybe some day I'll take you out to the satellite and show you how all this stuff works. It's really incredible.

question: Sure. We should do that one day.
answer: How 'bout tomorrow?

question: Tomorrow? Tomorrow's not good.
answer: What are you going to do, sit home and stew about your ex?

question: No.
answer: Oh, okay. I guess I crossed the line. Sorry.

question: You didn't cross the line.
answer: No? Cool. I'll pick you up at six-thirty. On the flip side.

question: Great work Steve-o. So you're feeling good?
answer: Yeah.

question: Did I hear something about you having some troubles at home?
answer: Robin and I have been having a difficult time. I moved out, but I really think it's only temporary.

question: Thank you. I will. I'll be right back. Hello.
answer: Steven, what are you doing here?

question: I was just in the area. Thought I'd pop by. How's work? How'd the big teen crush article come out?
answer: They liked it. I thought we agreed we weren't going to see each other for a month.

question: I know, it's just Daniels accepted my proposal to renovate the old schoolhouse.
answer: That's wonderful, congratulations.

question: I know I'm breaking the rules, but come have dinner with me tonight to celebrate.
answer: I don't think we should.

question: Come on, this is the biggest day of my career.
answer: Don't put me in this position.

question: What position? I want to share this with you.
answer: I love you, but I need to take some time on my own to see how I feel. You agreed to this. I mean this is exactly why we broke up, because you never listen to me.

question: I love you, but I need to take some time on my own to see how I feel. You agreed to this. I mean this is exactly why we broke up, because you never listen to me.
answer: What? Now we're broken up? What happened to 'trial separation?'

question: I can't get into this now. If you haven't noticed, I'm at work.
answer: Sorry to disturb you.

question: Thanks.
answer: Steven!!!! Stev-ey!!!! Let's go!!!! Steven!!!! Hey buddy!!! Come on down!!!

question: What the hell. How's it going?
answer: Howdy partner. Climb aboard. Thanks for coming out. You know most people think cable is just a simple co-ax that comes out of the wall. They never take the time to understand how it works.

question: Where exactly are we goin?
answer: We're going to take a ride on the information superhighway. It all started in Lansford, Pennsylvania where Panther Valley Television, with the assistance of Jerrod Electronics, created the first cable television system. I went to Lansford once. It's the Cable Guy's Mecca. It was very emotional. I come here to think sometimes. To clear my head. There she is. Right now she's sending entertainment and information to millions of satisfied citizens.

question: That's pretty impressive.
answer: See, I knew the moment I met you that you would appreciate this. The future is now. Soon every American home will integrate their television, phone, and computer. You'll be able to visit the Louvre on one channel, and watch female mud wrestling on another. You can do your shopping at home, or play Mortal Kombat with a friend in Vietnam. There's no end to the possibilities. Come on up! What are you waiting for?! Sometimes I'll sit here and imagine that there are billions of bits of information surging through me.

question: I've watched a lot of TV in my life. I guess I've always taken it for granted.
answer: When I was a kid my mom worked nights. Never met dad. But the old TV was always there for me.

question: I know what you mean. My dad was there, but he might as well have been gone. My mom is a stewardess. She was always out of town.
answer: That's tough. You must have a lot of abandonment issues. Reality isn't "Father Knows Best," it's a kick in the face on Saturday night. But what doesn't kill us makes us stronger, right?

question: You know my brother's a speech therapist.
answer: So?

question: Never mind.
answer: So, you're pretty love struck about your lady, huh?

question: I miss her. I asked her to marry me, and she asked me to move out.
answer: I hate that.

question: She said she felt pressured. Can you believe that?
answer: Women are a labyrinth. Can I be frank? I don't think you listen to her. I think you try to tell her what she wants to hear. She wants you to thirst for knowledge about who she is. All the complicated splendor that is woman. When your love is truly giving, it will come back to you ten-fold.

question: You're right. That is remarkably insightful.
answer: Yeah, it was Jerry Springer's final thought on Friday's show. You know what? Women are suckers for "Sleepless in Seattle." It's on HBO this month. That's your bait right there.

question: Robin loves that movie.
answer: They all do. Next time you talk to her tell her you're cooking yourself dinner, and watching it by yourself. Sound like you're happier than a pig in shit. She'll come running. Betcha. Then just play it cool.

question: Maybe I will. Thanks a lot. I'm embarrassed to say this, but I don't know your name. What is it?
answer: You really want to know my name? You do? Really? It's Ernie Douglas. But my friends call me Chip.

question: I'll see ya' Chip.
answer: Let's just remember right now. You know some people walk through their entire lives and never find a true friend. I guess we're the lucky ones.

question: Uh good-bye.
answer: Later buddy. I'll catch ya' on the flip side.

question: I don't listen to you. I pretend to understand but I'm really just saying what I think you want to hear. So from now on I'm going to try my best to listen more because I do love you and am interested in learning about every detail about the complicated splendor that is you.
answer: Oh.

question: I want us to get back together, but I can see why taking this time might be good for us. So, I'm not mad.
answer: Sometimes time apart is healthy.

question: You're right. Well, that's what I came here to say. Look, I've got to get back to the office.
answer: So, are you doing anything tomorrow?

question: I'm just going to cook myself dinner and watch a movie. "Sleepless in Seattle" is on cable.
answer: Really?

question: If you're around you should drop by and check out the new apartment.
answer: Okay, maybe I will.

question: All right, so we're playing that type of game. Prison rules. I get it. Feed me the rock! Feed me the rock! I'm open! And one! That's definitely a foul! You want to mug me, my wallet is in my other pants.
answer: What are you doing?

question: Don't play from fear Steven. We can take these guys. Take it to the hole! Hey, are you okay?
answer: Yeah. I'm fine.

question: What are you doing?
answer: It was payback time. I was protecting you.

question: You ruined the game.
answer: I don't appreciate your tone Steven. That's not the way friends speak to each other.

question: What are you talking about? I don't even know you!
answer: Well let's fix that. Let me buy you a Heineken?

question: No, I'm going home.
answer: Well, uh, I guess we'll talk later. I've got to go shower up and do some stuff. I'll call you if I get a chance. Or you call me or something. And down low. Too slow. Have a good one.

question: Yeah, have a good one.
answer: We're having ourselves quite a little game of phone tag here. You're it! I was just blow drying my hair and I thought I heard the phone ringing. you're a tough man to reach. I guess you're too busy to call your friends.

question: Hey, good to see you. Come on in. What do you think of the place?
answer: You made some interesting choices laying out the room.

question: That's actually where the movers put the furniture. I'm gonna change it, very soon.
answer: No, I like it. So how's work?

question: Work's good.
answer: How's Hal?

question: Don't get me started. That guy has no vision. It's like working for Mr. MaGoo. He's just worthless.
answer: It's just great that you're getting to do it. It's a real step up.

question: I know. Now if only someone at corporate smartened up enough to dump Hal, then I could really get some stuff done.
answer: It's nice to see you doing so well.

question: Well, it's nice just to see you. Hey, it should be starting. Damn cable is out. Son of a bitch.
answer: It's alright. We can watch it another night.

question: No, no. We really should see it now. Now's a good time. Wait, wait. I know what to do. The Cable Guy's a friend of mine. I'll just page him. We'll have this fixed in no time. That was fast.
answer: Is there a problem with your service?

question: Yeah my cable went out.
answer: Really? So you called me. Interesting how you call when you need something. Is that how you treat people?

question: I've been really busy. You've got to get my cable going, Robin is here. This is really important.
answer: But calling me back isn't?

question: I'm sorry. Please, you've got to help me.
answer: Why should I help you? I gave you free cable. What have you ever done for me?

question: Anything you want. Name it  quickly.
answer: Tomorrow night, we hang out.

question: Fine, whatever you want.
answer: God bless you. You're too good to me. All set.

question: So what's with the cut cord?
answer: That's for effect. See ya' tomorrow Steven. She's pretty. And don't kiss her. Don't even touch her. Fight the urge at all costs. It will pay off later with Enjoy the flick.

question: Nobody.
answer: Sorry about yesterday. I was in kind of a weird mood. How'd things go with you? Keep 'em closed.

question: Pretty well. We'll see. Look, about the other night. I didn't appreciate you --
answer: Don't peek. I want this to be a surprise.

question: I really don't need to be surprised. Where are we going?
answer: Only the best restaurant in town. Okay, here we are. Open sesame.

question: Medieval Times?
answer: I know what you're thinking. Don't worry, I'm buying.

question: Funny. I never thought I would ever come here.
answer: I love this place. I come here twice a week. Oh man, that's my look. I love big butts. Ow, that hurts. There oughta be a law. Man she is hot. It's just not fair.

question: Please don't.
answer: You know what I need right now? Pooooon tang. And I'm not talking about the place in Vietnam.

question: Good to know.
answer: Dost thou have a mug of ale for me and me mate? He has been pitched in battle for a fortnight an has a King's thirst for the beer thust thou might have for thust. There you go.

question: Thanks for the help.
answer: Steven, don't turn around, but there is a woman eyeing you like you are a piece of meat and she hasn't eaten in a week.

question: Really? What does she look like?
answer: Shoe's a hottie. I wish she was checking me out. Man -- she is on fire! Total robo-babe.

question: Are you serious?
answer: Don't look.

question: I've got to look.
answer: Okay, but play it cool. Just turn like you are looking for the waitress. Ha-ha. I'm just messing with your mind. But you fell for it man. You are one horny Indian Chief.

question: You got me.
answer: So what did you want to rap about? Hold that thought. Show's on.

question: Let the games begin! The Red Knight rules! Blue Knight! You're going down! Going down!
answer: Could I get a knife and fork? There were no utensils, but there was Pepsi?

question: Spill his blood! Take his kead! Show no mercy! Come on, get into it, we won!
answer: Way to go Red Knight. Good job of killing. Good work.

question: So, what were you saying before?
answer: How do I put this? I've really enjoyed hanging out with you, but...

question: That's why I became a cable guy. To make friends like you. Every time I walk up to a new door, that door is a possibility for friendship. When I walked in your apartment I knew there was something there. I just knew it.
answer: Oh lord. I want you to know --

question: What's going on?
answer: We're going to do battle. It'll be fun.

question: Is this a normal part of the show?
answer: No, but I give all the Knights free cable. They said it would be cool if we just went at it for a little while.

question: Is this safe?
answer: That's what the armor's for.

question: What are we supposed to do? We've got to be careful we don't hurt each other.
answer: I cannot listen to any of your instructions for you are my sworn enemy, and are about to meet your demise.

question: Just take it easy. What are you doing?!
answer: I'm trying to kill you.

question: Hey, watch it!
answer: This is just like when Spock had to fight Kirk on 'Star Trek.' Best friends forced to do battle. That's the spirit. Let's give 'em a good show. So that's how it's gonna be, huh? All right. If you want to play rought, Daddy can play rough.

question: Chip, this isn't funny! Will you stop it!
answer: The name is Spock. If we don't battle to the death, they'll kill us both. Good-bye Jim.

question: Don't do this!
answer: Jim, we have no choice!

question: Oh my god. Are you okay?
answer: Well done good sir. You are the victor, but we shall meet again. You've got a real warrior's instinct.

question: I've got to admit there's a real feeling of power holding that jousting stick.
answer: If Robin saw you tonight, she would be begging you to take her back. I'm telling you these knights get laid all the time.

question: We should go again next week.
answer: Easy there Lancelot. Nobody loves ya. Hey, I think I left my staple gun in the living room the other day. Could you be a pal? What do you think?

question: What is this?
answer: I took the liberty of updating your in home entertainment system. I got you the big screen, plus THX quality sound that would make George Lucas cream in his pants.

question: You went in my house when I wasn't home?
answer: How else was I supposed to get the stuff in here? Magic?

question: How much did this cost?
answer: Practically nothing. I have a connection. Preferred customer. I hook him up, he hooks me up.

question: Look, I can't accept this. I wouldn't feel right.
answer: Yes but you give me something so much more valuable friendship.

question: And you've given me friendship, so we're even. Really, don't take it personally, but you've got to take it back.
answer: Well, my buddy with the pick-up truck works all week. Is it all right if I leave it here till Saturday?

question: Sure, no problem. And don't get me wrong. I really appreciate the gesture.
answer: Mm-hmm. Staple gun?

question: Oh, right. Robin, it's Steven again. I'm still trying to reach you. Okay, I'm at work. Call me.
answer: How's it going?

question: Good.
answer: Good good?

question: Great.
answer: Good. Keep it up.

question: Hey, I had the best time the other night. When am I going to get you on my couch again?
answer: Well tonight's not looking too good. How about tomorrow?

question: Chip?
answer: I knew I'd get you on the phone that way. Listen, that equipment will be history the day after tomorrow. It sure would be a pity to leave that karaoke machine a virgin.

question: What do you mean?
answer: Tomorrow night, you are having a karaoke jam. No ifs ands or buts. Well maybe a few butts. Later gator.

question: Hey Robin. What's up? Did you get my message?
answer: Yes. You left me five messages. It king of freaked me out.

question: Sorry. I've been trying to reach you 'cause I'm having a party. You've got to come over.
answer: I can't. I'm going to dinner with someone.

question: Dinner? What, like a date?
answer: Not really a date.

question: You've got a date?! I thought things were going well between us.
answer: They are.

question: So why are you going out on a date?
answer: I made it before we got together the other night. I knew you would freak out.

question: I'm not freaking out.
answer: Yes, you are freaking out.

question: I'm not. I just can't believe you would do this.
answer: I'm not doing anything wrong. I'm allowed to date. It's not like we're back together. We had a good time the other night, and you're already pressuring me.

question: Fine, enjoy yourself. Have fun.
answer: I will.

question: Fine. Bye.
answer: This is just a sign that you need to live a little. She's having fun, and you should too.

question: You're probably right.
answer: Damn right I'm right.

question: Oh, I got you a little something.
answer: I thought you said we were even. You're breaking the rules.

question: So shoot me. My brother said it might help with your lisp.
answer: Words cannot express

question: It's no big deal.
answer: Yes it is. Now I'm on a mission. This has got to be the best party ever! Let's rock.

question: You've got plenty of friends.
answer: These people are acquaintances. They're not ride to the airport friends, like us. Whoa, chick alert at three o'clock. A real barn burner. Don't look.

question: You're playing with me again.
answer: No sirree Steven. This woman is all over you like a lamp-shade.

question: Shut up.
answer: Did it just get hotter in here? Oh, that hurts.

question: Who'd she come with?
answer: I don't know, but she looks pretty available to me. I'd strike while the iron is hot. He who hesitates, masturbates, know what I'm saying?

question: I'm glad you accepted my invitation.
answer: Steven invited me.

question: Look at him. Have you ever seen him so alive? He's changing, Rick. You've got to learn to live with that.
answer: I don't know what your story is "Chip Douglas," but I'm going to find out.

question: Oooh. How dramatic.
answer: I'm getting out of here.

question: I'm getting out of here.
answer: Why? This is a great party. This girl is really into me.

question: You're whacked man. That guy is bad news.
answer: You don't even know him. You're just mad 'cause he kicked your ass in basketball.

question: Hello everyone. First of all I'd like to thank Steven for being such a terific host. Don't forget to kick in some spinach for the beer. Steven ain't made of money. And I expect some of you to join in the clean up crew. No I really couldn't. Okay, just to stop that guy from begging. This number is dedicated to all of the ladies in the house.
answer: You sounded just like Olivia Newton John. So what do you do? Oh okay. She says she wants a break, and that's fine with me. I think I needed some time also.

question: Good morning sleepy head. I hope you don't mind, I crashed on the couch. Bacon and eggs coming up.
answer: Where did Heather go?

question: I heard her slip out early this morning.
answer: What a night. That was just what I needed.

question: You look like a new man.
answer: I feel like a new man. I was getting so used to being rejected. I really liked her.

question: Hey, it was my treat.
answer: What do you mean it was "your treat?"

question: You know, I bought this time, you buy next time.
answer: Buy what?

question: You know, the women.
answer: You mean Heather is a prostitute?

question: Of course she is. Do you think a woman like that would hang out with us if we weren't paying? Don't tell me you didn't know.
answer: I can't believe this.

question: I wish I had friends like that.
answer: Get out of my house!

question: Don't be ashamed of yourself. I know she was a working girl, but she kind of liked you. You might have been able to get a freebie.
answer: Out, now! I don't ever want to see you again. Robin is never going to forgive me.

question: I'll tell you how to handle that. Don't tell her. You want to get her back, I'll help you get her back.
answer: I don't want your help. I want you to leave. And take that stuff out of here.

question: My brother and I wanna start our own sun block company. But the twist is, it's only for skiing. SkiBlock. Or SunSki. We haven't decided yet. Maybe BlockSki. Do you think that sounds good?
answer: BlockSki? That sounds right.

question: So, Gail told me you're just coming off a relationship.
answer: Well, not really. We're kind of in a holding pattern. He wants more of a commitment, but I don't think I'm ready. I just want to have a good time for a while.

question: Then we got to get you on a Skidoo!
answer: Skidoo?

question: High powered snow mobile. It'll blow your mind. It flies over powder like it's glass. Hey, how are you doing on that chicken? Have the eggs hatched yet? Thanks. So, how's your work going?
answer: It's been crazy. They just hired a

question: Hold that thought. I have to use the rest room. Be right back.
answer: My pleasure. Enjoy your meal Good evening sir. Pleasant night, isn't it?

question: Yeah.
answer: But I guess the weather's always pleasant in here. The winters are remarkably mild. If you need anything, just let me know. Anything at all.

question: I think I can handle it.
answer: I'm here to serve you.

question: Jesus! Get out of here!
answer: Most people never bother to take advantage of all my services, for instance I can help you wash up. Cleanliness is so very important. Then once you're done I have a variety of skin care products which can make you look years younger. This lotion is superb at removing liver spots. This one is an excellent moisturizer. And one can never underestimate the effects of a good cologne. Mm High Karate. And now a touch of powder. Ooh, I almost forget, it's oh so very important to be properly tweezed. You're on a big date, you'll need fresh breath. Whoops, that's not mouth wash. But that reminds me. Proper hair care is a must. Looking good, now let's dry you off. Now suck it. Suck the air! from this angle you look just like Neil Armstrong experiencing G-Force. I believe you have the "right stuff." Don't worry about the tip. But I've got one for you. Stay away from Robin. She's taken. Excuse me, apartment 202 is Robin Harris?

question: Most people never bother to take advantage of all my services, for instance I can help you wash up. Cleanliness is so very important. Then once you're done I have a variety of skin care products which can make you look years younger. This lotion is superb at removing liver spots. This one is an excellent moisturizer. And one can never underestimate the effects of a good cologne. Mm High Karate. And now a touch of powder. Ooh, I almost forget, it's oh so very important to be properly tweezed. You're on a big date, you'll need fresh breath. Whoops, that's not mouth wash. But that reminds me. Proper hair care is a must. Looking good, now let's dry you off. Now suck it. Suck the air! from this angle you look just like Neil Armstrong experiencing G-Force. I believe you have the "right stuff." Don't worry about the tip. But I've got one for you. Stay away from Robin. She's taken. Excuse me, apartment 202 is Robin Harris?
answer: Who is it?

question: It's the Cable Guy.
answer: There's no problem with my cable.

question: I've got an upgrade order for one Robin Harris. The Rainbow package, that's every pay channel available.
answer: I didn't order this.

question: Apparently you've got a secret admirer.
answer: Was it a man named Steven?

question: I can't tell you.
answer: Come on.

question: No, I promised Steven I wouldn't say. Whoops, I slipped. Well you didn't hear it from me. I'm sorry Steven. I'm just a man. That about does it. Enjoy.
answer: So, are you a friend of Steven's?

question: I'm proud to say I am. I installed his cable recently, and we just hit it off.
answer: That's right. You fixed his cable the other night. So you guys are going out a lot?

question: Not really. That man is devoted to you. You know I'm probably crossing a boundary telling you this, but he's really crazy about you.
answer: Did he say that?

question: Only every five minutes. Quite frankly, I'm sick of hearing it. No, I'm just kidding with you. He's a good man. He mentioned that you guys have had some problems.
answer: Well, it's a little complicated.

question: It always is. You know I asked a woman to marry me once. She said she wanted to think about it. We agreed to take some time apart to re-assess our feelings. To give each other space. Well, she is no longer with us.
answer: I'm so sorry.

question: Sometimes you don't have the time you think you have. Just promise me you'll never go bungee jumping in Mexico.
answer: I promise.

question: Hello?
answer: I love you.

question: Robin?
answer: Yes.

question: I love you too.
answer: That was so sweet of you.

question: Oh well
answer: You didn't have to do that.

question: I wanted to.
answer: Giving me free cable. Only you would do that.

question: You got it? Great.
answer: Yes, your friend came by.

question: My friend?
answer: The Cable Guy. I liked him. He was kind of goofy, but nice. Thank you so much for doing that.

question: I'm glad you liked it. I've wanted to do something nice for you, but I've been trying to give you your space.
answer: Well, I don't think we should make rules anymore.

question: Sure. I'll call you as son as I get home. Bye.
answer: Steven, are you ready to go?

question: The concert. Oh Jesus.
answer: What?

question: Robin just called. I think we're getting back together.
answer: So you're blowing me off? I can't believe this.

question: This is the first time she asked to get back together.
answer: You do this every time. You only call me after a girl breaks your heart. "Oh Rick can I stay on your couch? Let's talk all night about how mean girls are." Then as soon as a relationship starts again it's bye-bye Rick. I don't know why I fall for it anymore.

question: Can't you get someone else to go?
answer: Maybe I'll take MY cable guy.

question: Pretty smooth work. I set 'em up, you knock 'em down.
answer: What?

question: Robin. I got her back for you. I juiced her up.
answer: How do you know we're back together?

question: Free cable is the ultimate aphrodisiac.
answer: I don't want you messing around with my life. You've caused enough trouble as it is.

question: I know. I felt bad about the other night, so I wanted to make it up to you. So what are you doing? Do you want to catch a bite?
answer: Look, I appreciate you helping me out with Robin. But you have to understand, I'm going to have to work extra hard to not screw this relationship up again. You're a great guy, but I just don't have any room in my life for a new friend. Do you understand?

question: I appreciate your honesty. You're a real straight shooter.
answer: So, you're okay?

question: Hey, I'm a big boy. It's no big deal. Whatever.
answer: All right well, take care.

question: Hey, it's Chip Douglas.
answer: Chip Douglas?

question: Your cable guy.
answer: Oh, hi. What's up?

question: I feel kind of weird calling you. It's just I'm worried about Steven.
answer: What is it?

question: Something isn't right. He hasn't been himself lately. Have you noticed anything?
answer: No, things are actually going really well.

question: Good.
answer: Should I be worried?

question: Nope. I'm probably just being a nervous nellie. Let's just keep our eyes open.
answer: I will. Good-bye. Steven Bartowsky please.

question: Hey, relax. I'm the one who's going to jail.
answer: I can't believe you did this.

question: I didn't do anything. My cable guy gave me all that stuff as a present.
answer: A stereo system and a big screen TV as a present? You expect me to believe that? You know you're killing your mother with this.

question: I swear it's true.
answer: Why would you accept such extravagant gifts?

question: I don't know. I shouldn't have.
answer: What is really going on here Steven? Are you on something?

question: I'm fine! I didn't do anything! Please call my cable guy, his name is Ernie Douglas.
answer: You want to tell us the truth now

question: That's got to be a mistake. Oh, this is not happening.
answer: Yes it is, and it's killing your mother. Did you deliberately want to ruin our fortieth anniversary party on Monday, Steven?

question: Yeah, Dad, I did. It's all a big plan. When can you get me out of here? The entire weekend? What did you hear? What did you hear?
answer: Hello Steven. I came as soon as I heard.

question: Who are you?! What's your real name?!
answer: So many questions.

question: Why are you doing this to me?
answer: I didn't do this to you, you did this to you. You need to learn who your friends are.

question: You set me up.
answer: I taught you a lesson. I can be your best friend, or your worst enemy. I hope you'll choose the latter I mean, the former. You know what I mean.

question: I'll never be your friend. You need help.
answer: Right now I think you're the one who needs help. I'm here to give you comfort. Come on, touch it. Come on. You need human contact. Touch it.

question: I will not touch it. What are you doing? Stop it.
answer: I know how you're feeling right now.

question: Stop it! Stop it!
answer: I'm here for you.

question: Get off there! Are you trying to get me killed?
answer: I was just messing with your mind. That was from 'Midnight Express.' Awesome film. Oliver Stone won the Academy Award for the screenplay.

question: Guard! Guard!
answer: Don't you worry about Robin, I'll make sure she's well taken care of.

question: You go near her, I'll kill you. Hey, this is the guy who framed me!
answer: Louis, how'd you like that Tyson fight on Pay Per View? I told you it's more fun when it's Free Per View. Sea shells. Sea shells. Salmon. Salmon. Silverware. Silverware. Suspicious. Suspicious. Sensational. Sensational.

question: Louis, how'd you like that Tyson fight on Pay Per View? I told you it's more fun when it's Free Per View. Sea shells. Sea shells. Salmon. Salmon. Silverware. Silverware. Suspicious. Suspicious. Sensational. Sensational.
answer: Hello.

question: Hello. I'm sorry we have to meet under these circumstances.
answer: Me too. Believe me.

question: I know we don't know each other very well, but we do have one thing in common, our concern for Steven.
answer: Well, you were right. Something's happening with him and he won't even acknowledge it.

question: If he refuses to admit he has a problem, we may have to let him hit bottom. He's gonna need some tough love.
answer: You know his lawyer said that nobody named Ernie Douglas works for the Cable Company.

question: Did he do a name search? 'Cause I work under a pseudonym so the customers won't harass me at home. Kind of like a stripper. My real name is Larry, Larry Tate.
answer: And he's saying he received all the stereo equipment from you.

question: (I know, and I'm not mad. He's been cornered, so he's telling some wives tales. He doesn't mean to hurt me.
answer: I just feel like I triggered this with him. It's not that I don't want to get married, it's just I felt like he wanted to get married just to get married. I don't deal well with pressure.

question: Hey, welcome to the human race. We're not perfect. We all think we have to look like a 'Baywatch' babe and be as witty as 'Seinfeld.' Give yourself a break.
answer: God I could go for turkey and mashed potatoes now.

question: Comfort food. Bring it on.
answer: Exactly.

question: I'm sorry dad.
answer: I don't want to hear it. Do you know the pain you out your mother through? You're lucky she didn't die of a heart attack.

question: I didn't do anything.
answer: Just like you said you didn't steal that 'X-Men' comic book when you were eight. Then I found it in your underwear drawer.

question: Will you ever stop mentioning that?
answer: This cost me a lot of money. You jump bail, and I swear I'll hire a bounty hunter to hunt you down.

question: Are you sure you're okay?
answer: I'm fine.

question: You're not fine. When you say you're fine, I know you're not fine.
answer: I just want to get this over with so I can go home and get some rest.

question: I wanted you to know I invited your friend. He was concerned about you.
answer: Great. I feel. Bad. I've been kind of blowing Rick off lately.

question: What is he doing here?
answer: I invited him.

question: When did you invite him?
answer: At lunch the other day.

question: At lunch? You had lunch with him?
answer: Hello. You look great.

question: And you are a vision. Hello Steven. You're looking rested.
answer: Come here.

question: Steven, what's with you tonight? I'm getting some really weird energy from you.
answer: Maybe it's because I just got out of prison, where you sent me. I should just drag you to the police right now.

question: You can if you like, but I'd hate to have to show Robin this.
answer: You son of a bitch.

question: So Steven is carrying this battle ax, and he's chasing me, swinging like a mad man. I'm yelling at him, 'hey, it's just a show!' Tell me something I don't know. This guy almost took my head off.
answer: What are you doing?

question: It's from "Goodfellas." Remember the intro scene at the bar. I'm Johnny Two Times. You'll never catch me copper. I'm gonna wear a disguise. Oh, you got me. Aaah!!! Nobody messes with me and lives! Oh man, you should have seen your face. It was classic.
answer: Very funny. Tony, go to your mother!

question: Look what you've done.
answer: I know you beat up Robin's date.

question: I guess I did what you didn't have the guts to do.
answer: You stay away from Robin.

question: You don't understand.
answer: I just think you were completely out of line. I don't know what's happening to you these days.

question: Robin, this guy is a sociopath. He leaves messages on my machine night and day. He shows up wherever I go. He won't leave me alone.
answer: Sounds familiar.

question: You know he was the one who beat up your date at that restaurant. That's right. And he gave you the free cable. It wasn't me.
answer: But you took the credit for it?

question: That's what he wanted. He was manipulating me. It feels so good to be honest about this. We're finally communicating. I've been wanting to tell you for so long, but he's been blackmailing me.
answer: Blackmailing you? How?

question: With a photograph.
answer: Of what?

question: Me with a... prostitute.
answer: What?!

question: He set it up. He invited this woman to my party and didn't tell me she was a prostitute. I'm so glad we can talk about this.
answer: When did you have a party?

question: When we weren't communicating. I invited you. You were out on a date.
answer: And you were with a prostitute.

question: She seduced me. That's what they do. They're professionals. And I didn't even know she was a prostitute.
answer: So that makes it better?

question: That's not the point. The point is this guy has been setting me up. He's responsible.
answer: He didn't have sex with a whore. You did.

question: Robin you don't --
answer: I don't want to hear it. Breaking up was the best thing we ever did. You have some serious problems, and it's not my responsibility to help you. I am only responsible for my own happiness.

question: Where did that come from?
answer: It was Jerry Springer's "final thought."

question: I'm sorry I've been blowing you off.
answer: You bet your ass you've been blowing me off.

question: It's just, this guy is really doing a number on me.
answer: I told you not to hang out with him.

question: You're the one who told me to offer him money so I could get free cable.
answer: You didn't tell me he was a psychopath. I'll see if I can get my friend in research to track him down. What's his name again?

question: Ernie Douglas.
answer: Ernie Douglas? Ernie Douglas? Why does that sound so familiar?

question: Did anyone notice I'm late? Thank you. Work's good.
answer: How's Hal?

question: Don't get me started. That guy has no vision. It's like working for Mr. MaGoo. He's just worthless.
answer: It's just great that you're getting to do it. It's a real step up.

question: So we're nowhere. Ernie Douglas? Ernie Douglas? Could you stop that? Wait, could you start that again? Start tapping your foot again.
answer: Hello.

question: Bingo. "My Three Sons."
answer: Chip and Ernie Douglas.

question: I've got a list of every cable installer fired in the last four years. Every one of these guys has the same physical description as our friend. Murray Slaughter, Brendan Walsh, Sam Malone, Alex Reiger. There was even a guy who liked to be called 'the big Ragu.'
answer: Carmine from "Laverne and Shirley."

question: That's so sad that you know that. Anyway, the cable company in town fired a guy six months ago named Darren Stevens. He stole the truck and disappeared. That's our guy.
answer: So he doesn't even work for the Cable Company?

question: You owe me! I just want to hang out. No big deal. Steven, you're just like me. We're cut from the same cloth. We're one and the same!
answer: Oh my god. She's right. I am a smotherer. I'm just like him. Hello.

question: It didn't have to come to this Steven. We could have been blood brothers.
answer: Rick told me you were fired from The Cable Company. You're not even a real cable guy.

question: Do you feel good now that you've hurt me? Well now I'm going to have to hurt you. I'm going to take away what you hold dearest in the world.
answer: I swear to God, if you touch --

question: Could you hold on a second, I've got call waiting. It'll just be a sec. Sorry about that. Where was I? Oh yeah. You're going to feel my wrath.
answer: Don't do this. There must be some way for us to work this out.

question: I wish there was. Oh Steven, I'm just so tired. So very tired.
answer: Let's talk in person. Where are you?

question: I'm close. So very close. You know, I don't think you're right for Robin. She needs someone who can be sensitive to her needs. Someone who understands her soul.
answer: You stay away from her.

question: Aren't we the control freak. Looks like you're starting to sweat.
answer: I got the camera. You can't see me.

question: Hello.
answer: Hey Rick. I need to meet with you right away. I've got some information about this crazy cable guy.

question: Me too. I've got the whole story.
answer: That's great. Let's meet at the old school at nine-thirty.

question: Why all the way out there?
answer: I think he's been following me. Don't be late, buddy. Be home! Be home!

question: Steven? Steven?
answer: Hey Rick. I'm really excited to hear what you found out about this nut.

question: I hit the Holy Grail. This guy is deeply troubled. Only child. His mother was arrested for prostitution, and phone solicitation. Apparently she was some phone sex pioneer.
answer: No way.

question: Really? Tell me more. I'm very interested in learning everything I can about that wacked out cable installer. It sounds like he might hurt somebody.
answer: Hello.

question: Nosey friends for two hundred. This supposed pal of Steven's is currently residing in the intensive care unit of Good Samaritan Hospital.
answer: Rick.

question: I'm sorry, you didn't answer in the form of a question.
answer: Rick Legatos. He's a friend of mine. Where is he? Can I see him?

question: Hello.
answer: Poor Rick. Seems he had a little accident with the business end of a staple gun.

question: You're not going to get away with this.
answer: The question is, are you going to get away with it? Apparently there was an anonymous tip placed to the police leading them to a staple gun at the crime scene with your fingerprints all over it. Be right there.

question: Was that Robin?
answer: I've got to go. We're going to take a romantic stroll on the information superhighway. ...it all started in Lansford, Pennsylvania where Panther Valley Television, with the assistance of Jerrod Electronics, created the first cable television system. The future is now. Soon every American home will integrate their television, phone, and computer. You'll be able to visit the Louvre on one channel, and watch female mud wrestling on another. You can do your shopping at home, or play a game of Mortal Kombat with a friend in Vietnam.

question: I've got to go. We're going to take a romantic stroll on the information superhighway. ...it all started in Lansford, Pennsylvania where Panther Valley Television, with the assistance of Jerrod Electronics, created the first cable television system. The future is now. Soon every American home will integrate their television, phone, and computer. You'll be able to visit the Louvre on one channel, and watch female mud wrestling on another. You can do your shopping at home, or play a game of Mortal Kombat with a friend in Vietnam.
answer: This is really fascinating, but I really think we ought to go now.

question: I knew you'd appreciate it. I took Steven here once, and he didn't give a rats ass about my interests.
answer: I'm worried about Steven.

question: Maybe Steven should be worried about you. So, where was I? Ichabod Crane! The Disney Channel showed it all last month. Let's get ready to ruuuuuummmmbbble!!!!
answer: Where's Robin?!

question: This isn't about Robin, this is about you and me.
answer: Where's Robin?!!! Tell me!

question: I'm sorry, I didn't catch the question? Steven you've changed. I like it. I think it's time to make you cable ready. Last time we fought I let you win! Best two out of three! You treat me like the TV! You use me, but you can't live without me! You can't shut me off with your remote control!!!! I'm not like Robin and Rick and Mommy and Daddy and brother and sister and cousin --
answer: I got the point.
